medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The back pain began six months prior to admission after a fall. Initially intermittent, the pain gradually became constant. One month before admission, following a second fall, the pain worsened.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Right inguinal herniorrhaphy performed at age one; otherwise, normal development, with no history of joint dislocations, dental problems, or easy bruising.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal great-grandmother had diabetes mellitus type 2, heart disease, and breast cancer; maternal grandfather had heart disease; paternal grandmother had hypothyroidism and died of viral cardiomyopathy at 45. No family history of calcium or bone abnormalities, recurrent fractures, or dislocations.
